title: Administration
adminPanelDescription: Manage users, site settings, and authentication configuration
noPermissionToAccess: You don't have permission to access this page.
defaultAdminAccountWarning: The default admin account (admin@example.com) still exists. This is a security risk. Please create a new admin user first, then delete this default account.
cannotDeleteOwnAccount: You cannot delete your own account
tagDeletedSuccessfully: Tag and all associations deleted successfully
settingsSavedSuccessfully: ‚úÖ Settings saved successfully! Changes are applied immediately.
emailServerNotAvailable: Email server is not available: {{error}}. Please configure email settings before creating users.
userCreatedButEmailFailed: User created successfully, but invitation email could not be sent: {{error}}. The user will need to be manually activated.
emailServerNotAvailableForResend: Email server is not available: {{error}}. Please configure email settings before resending invitations.

users.title: Users
users.description: Manage user accounts and permissions. Regular users can only manage their own profile information, while administrators have full access to manage all content, users, and site settings.
users.failedToCheckUserLimit: Failed to check user limit. Please try again.
users.userLimitReached: User limit reached. Cannot create more users.
users.activeCreateLocally: Active (create user locally without sending invite)
users.instanceOwnerEmailCannotBeChanged: Instance owner email cannot be changed
users.instanceOwnerEmailCannotBeModified: As the instance owner, your email address cannot be modified.
users.accountNotActivatedYet: This user hasn't activated their account yet.
users.deleteSystemUserWarning: Deleting the System User will affect users who delete their own accounts. Their tasks are normally reassigned to this account to preserve project history.
users.areYouSureProceed: Are you absolutely sure you want to proceed?
users.noTasksAffected: No tasks will be affected for
users.onlyOwnerCanEditProfile: Only owner can edit their profile

tags.title: Tags Management
tags.description: Create and manage tags for organizing tasks. Tags can have custom colors and descriptions.
tags.noTasksAffected: No tasks will be affected for

priorities.title: Priorities Management
priorities.description: Create and manage priority levels for tasks. Each priority has a custom color for visual identification.
priorities.willBeReassignedToDefault: will be reassigned to the default priority.

siteSettings.title: Site Settings
siteSettings.description: Configure basic site information that appears throughout the application.
siteSettings.websiteUrlDescription: URL to your customer portal for subscription management

sso.title: Single Sign-On Configuration
sso.description: Configure Google OAuth authentication. Changes are applied immediately without requiring a restart.
sso.googleClientIdDescription: Found in your Google Cloud Console under APIs & Services > Credentials
sso.googleClientSecretDescription: Keep this secret secure. Changes are applied immediately.
sso.googleCallbackUrlDescription: This must match exactly what you configure in Google Cloud Console. Include the full URL with protocol. https://yourdomain.com/api/auth/google/callback
sso.debugLoggingDescription: When enabled, detailed Google SSO authentication logs will be displayed in the server console for debugging purposes.
sso.debugLoggingNote: ‚ö†Ô∏è Note: A service/Docker restart may be required for debug log changes to take effect due to caching.
sso.hotReloadDescription: Google OAuth settings are automatically reloaded when you save changes. No application restart is required for most settings.
sso.reloadOAuthConfigTip: Use the "Reload OAuth Config" button if you need to force a reload.
sso.debugLoggingRestartNote: Debug logging changes may require a service restart due to memory caching.

mail.title: Mail Server Configuration
mail.description: Configure SMTP settings for sending emails. Changes are applied immediately.
mail.demoModeDescription: Email communication is disabled in demo mode. The mail server settings cannot be enabled to prevent sending emails from demo environments. This restriction will be automatically lifted when demo mode is disabled.
mail.managedEmailDescription: Your email service is currently managed by Easy Kanban. This means emails are sent using our infrastructure with the sender address
mail.switchToCustomSMTPConfirm: Are you sure you want to switch to custom SMTP settings? This will clear the current managed settings and require you to configure your own SMTP server. You will need to test the configuration before it can be enabled.
mail.statusDemoMode: Email functionality is disabled in demo mode to prevent sending emails from demo environments.
mail.statusTestRequired: ‚ö†Ô∏è Fill in the required fields below and test the mail server configuration. The toggle will be enabled after a successful test.
mail.statusTestedSuccessfully: ‚úÖ Mail server tested successfully! You can manually enable/disable it as needed. If disabled, you'll need to test again before re-enabling.
mail.smtpHostDescription: Hostname or IP of your SMTP server.
mail.autoFillHint: Tab into this field to auto-fill with Gmail example.
mail.autoFillPortHint: Tab into this field to auto-fill with common port.
mail.fromEmailDescription: Email address that appears as sender
mail.fromNameDescription: Display name that appears as sender
mail.testConfigurationDescription: Use the test button below to verify your mail server configuration works correctly.
mail.testingRequiredDescription: Fill in the required fields (SMTP Host, Port, Username, Password, From Email) and test your configuration. If the test succeeds, the mail server will be automatically enabled.
mail.testDisabledDemo: Email testing is disabled in demo mode
mail.testNotNeededManaged: Email testing is not needed for managed email service
mail.fillRequiredFields: Fill in all required fields to test email

appSettings.title: App Settings
appSettings.userInterfaceSettingsDescription: Configure application-wide behavior settings. These settings apply as defaults for all users, but users can override them in their personal preferences.
appSettings.defaultApplicationLanguageDescription: Set the default language for the application. This will be used for system-generated content.
appSettings.taskDeleteConfirmationDescription: Require confirmation before deleting tasks. Users can override this in their personal preferences.
appSettings.newUserDefaultsDescription: Configure default preferences for new users. Existing users keep their current settings.
appSettings.defaultViewModeDescription: Default view mode for new users (Kanban or List view)
appSettings.defaultTaskViewModeDescription: Default task card size for new users (Expanded or Collapsed)
appSettings.activityFeedDefaultsDescription: Configure default activity feed settings for new users. Users can override these in their personal preferences.
appSettings.defaultVisibilityDescription: Whether the activity feed is shown by default
appSettings.defaultPositionDescription: Default position for activity feed (JSON format: {"x": 0, "y": 66})
appSettings.notificationDelayDescription: Accumulate task changes and send consolidated notifications. Set to 0 for immediate notifications.
appSettings.notificationDelayHint: When multiple changes occur to the same task within this time period, they will be combined into a single notification email.
appSettings.globalNotificationDefaultsDescription: These settings control the default notification preferences for all users. Users can override these settings in their profile.
appSettings.emailSystemConfigured: Email system is configured and active
appSettings.emailSystemNotConfiguredHint: Configure SMTP settings in the Mail tab to enable email notifications.

notificationTypes.newTaskAssignedDescription: Get notified when someone assigns a task to you
notificationTypes.myTaskUpdatedDescription: Get notified when tasks assigned to you are modified
notificationTypes.watchedTaskUpdated: A task I'm watching is updated
notificationTypes.watchedTaskUpdatedDescription: Get notified when tasks you're watching are modified
notificationTypes.addedAsCollaborator: I'm added as a collaborator on a task
notificationTypes.addedAsCollaboratorDescription: Get notified when someone adds you as a collaborator
notificationTypes.collaboratingTaskUpdated: A task I'm collaborating in is updated
notificationTypes.collaboratingTaskUpdatedDescription: Get notified when tasks you're collaborating on are modified
notificationTypes.commentAdded: A comment is added to a task I'm involved in
notificationTypes.commentAddedDescription: Get notified when comments are added to tasks you're assigned, watching, or collaborating on
notificationTypes.requesterTaskCreated: A task is created and I'm the requester
notificationTypes.requesterTaskCreatedDescription: Get notified when tasks you requested are created
notificationTypes.requesterTaskUpdated: A task is updated where I'm the requester
notificationTypes.requesterTaskUpdatedDescription: Get notified when tasks you requested are modified

projectSettings.title: Project Settings
projectSettings.description: Configure project and task identifier prefixes and finished column detection.
projectSettings.finishedColumnNamesDescription: Define column names that should be automatically marked as "finished" (case-insensitive). Tasks in these columns won't be considered overdue regardless of their due date.
projectSettings.highlightOverdueTasksDescription: When enabled, overdue tasks will be highlighted with a "LATE" badge.
projectSettings.defaultProjectPrefixDescription: Prefix used for new board project identifiers (e.g., "PROJ-" ‚Üí "PROJ-00001")
projectSettings.defaultTaskPrefixDescription: Prefix used for new task ticket identifiers (e.g., "TASK-" ‚Üí "TASK-00001")
projectSettings.howItWorks1: New boards automatically get project identifiers: {{prefix}}00001, {{prefix}}00002, etc.
projectSettings.howItWorks2: New tasks automatically get ticket identifiers: {{prefix}}00001, {{prefix}}00002, etc.
projectSettings.howItWorks3: Numbers are auto-incremented and zero-padded to 5 digits
projectSettings.howItWorks4: Column names matching the finished list (case-insensitive) will automatically be marked as completed
projectSettings.howItWorks5: Tasks in finished columns won't be considered overdue regardless of their due date

sprintSettings.title: Sprint Settings
sprintSettings.description: Manage sprints and planning periods for reporting and time-based filters
sprintSettings.noSprintsCreatedDescription: Create your first sprint to enable sprint-based reporting
sprintSettings.aboutSprintsDescription: Sprints are used in reports to filter data by time periods. Mark a sprint as "Active" to make it the default selection in report date filters. You can have multiple sprints but only one should be active at a time.
sprintSettings.endDateAfterStartDate: End date must be after start date
sprintSettings.deleteSprintConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the sprint "{{name}}"?

reporting.title: Reports & Analytics Settings
reporting.description: Configure reporting features, gamification, and data retention
reporting.enableReportsModuleDescription: Master toggle for all reporting features
reporting.enableAchievementsDescription: Badge rewards section in "My Stats" report
reporting.reportsVisibilityDescription: Control who can access the Reports module (auto-saved)
reporting.manualSnapshotDescription: Capture current state of all tasks immediately
reporting.impactDescription: Frequent snapshots are safe and won't affect performance. Each snapshot takes ~100-500ms and creates one record per task. Use this to test reports or after making significant task changes.
reporting.failedToSaveSetting: Failed to save setting. Please try again.

licensing.title: Licensing
licensing.licenseInfoIncomplete: License information is incomplete or unavailable.
licensing.demoModeDescription: License system is disabled for demo purposes. This instance resets hourly and is for evaluation only.
licensing.selfHostedModeDescription: License system is disabled. This instance is running in self-hosted mode with no restrictions.
licensing.maxTasksPerBoardDescription: Maximum number of tasks allowed in each board
licensing.unlimitedTasksPerBoard: Unlimited tasks per board - no restrictions
licensing.onlyOwnerCanAccess: Only the instance owner can access subscription management.
licensing.customerPortalDescription: Manage your subscription, view billing history, change plans, and cancel your subscription through our customer portal.
licensing.websiteUrlNotConfigured: Website URL not configured. Please contact your system administrator to set the WEBSITE_URL in Site Settings.

fileUploads.title: File Upload Settings
fileUploads.description: Configure file upload restrictions and security settings. These settings control what types of files users can upload and their maximum size.
fileUploads.enforceUploadRestrictionsDescription: When enabled, file uploads will be restricted by size and type settings below. When disabled, all file uploads will be allowed regardless of these settings.
fileUploads.maximumFileSizeDescription: Set the maximum file size allowed for uploads. Larger files will be rejected.
fileUploads.allowedFileTypesDescription: Select which file types are allowed for upload. Unchecked types will be rejected.
